intro: Psychotria padifolia, commonly known as the Madagascar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of plant ecology and toxicity.
